title: Nick Hornby Books (Fiction, Non-fiction)
description:
Nick Hornby is the author of the novels A Long Way Down, Slam, How to Be Good, High Fidelity, and About a Boy, and the memoir Fever Pitch.

He is also the author of Songbook, a finalist for a National Book Critics Circle Award, Shakespeare Wrote for Money, and The Polysyllabic Spree, as well as the editor of the short-story collection Speaking with the Angel.

He is a recipient of the American Academy of Arts and LettersÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ E. M. Forster Award and the winner of the 2003 Orange Word International WritersÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ London Award. Among his many other honors and awards, four of his titles have been named New York Times Notable Books. A film written by Hornby, An Education Ã¢â‚¬â€œ shown at the Sundance Film Festival to great acclaim Ã¢â‚¬â€œ was the lead movie at the 2009 Toronto Film Festival and distributed by Sony that fall. That same September, the author published his latest novel, Juliet, Naked to wide acclaim. Hornby lives in North London.

Books contained in the Torrent:

Funny Girl (2015)

High Fidelity (1996)

About a Boy (1999)

A Long Way Down (2006)

How to Be Good (2002)

Juliet, Naked (2010)

Fever Pitch (1998)

31 Songs (2003)

The Polysyllabic Spree (2004)

More Baths Less Talking: Notes from the Reading Life of a
Celebrated Author Locked in Battle with Football, Family, Time Itself (2012)

An Education: The Screenplay (2009)

Everyone's Reading Bastard (2012)

Not a Star and Otherwise Pandemonium (2009)

George & Sam: Two Boys, One Family, and Autism (2007)
